title: Lil Nas X Trolls Critics With Website About Being Saved From 'Devil-Worshipping' - The Messenger
text: [Mother of Family Found Dead in 27-Room Boston Mansion Was CEO, on Board of Red Cross Charity](/news/mother-family-murder-suicide-boston-mansion-ceo-red-cross-teena-kamal?utm_source=onsite&utm_medium=trending_story) Lil Nas X Trolls Critics With Website About Being Saved From ‘Devil-Worshipping’ Lil Nas X has recently teased fans that he plans to release Christian music after his 2021 'Montero' music video saw him riding a pole to Hell and giving Satan a lap dance [Glenn Garner](/author/glenn-garner) Lil Nas X is putting on the theatrics once again as he teases his upcoming sophomore album and a new creative era. The Grammy Award winner has released SaveNasX.com , a very '90s-style website promoting his new work that features a clock counting the time since his debut studio album Montero dropped in 2021. "LIL NAS X hasn't released an album in over two years," reads a blurb on the page. "This site is dedicated to finding him and saving him by turning his heart toward Christ's light!" It further reads, "Has the DEVIL-WORSHIPPING pop-artist finally been sacrificed to HIS MASTER? WHY is he SECLUDING HIMSELF???? What is he PREPARING FOR? This site will answer ALL THESE QUESTIONS AND MORE!!!... We will find Montero, and WE WILL SAVE HIM BY RETURNING HIS HEART TO J.CHRIST'S LIGHT " Lil Nas X's latest publicity stunt comes after he made waves with his 2021 music video for " Montero (Call Me By Your Name) ," which saw him riding a pole down to Hell and giving Satan a lap dance. The "Industry Baby" artist has since teased fans that he plans to release Christian music next. "Y'all mind if I enter my Christian era?" he wrote last month, sharing a taste of a potential new spiritual song.
